title: Penny Lancaster breaks down in tears giving update on Rod Stewart cancer battle
text:

Penny Lancaster broke down in tears on today's Loose Women while giving update on Rod Stewart's cancer battle.

Much-loved singer Rod underwent a secret battle with prostate cancer for two-and-a-half years before being given the all clear.

Penny explained they decided to keep his devastating diagnosis secret and only told the older children.

The Loose Women panellist revealed Rod had intensive radiation treatment every single day for three months at a London clinic.

In a video message from New York, Rod said: "I've juts been given the OK. Guy,s please get down to the doctors and get tested, It's a rotten disease. Finger up the bum, no harm done."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Penny said there was "no slowing" Rod down after thankfully being given the all clear.

Explaining why they kept it quiet, Penny said: "It was our choice to come out [with the news], as it were. Rod was performing at a prostate cancer event with the Faces.

"After a few songs he said, ‘Hi everyone, thank you so much for coming and I have to just take this moment, I owe it to everyone, I’m a survivor’.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

"In July he got the all clear, there’s no trace at all – he just wanted to give a message out to all men, especially over 50, you can actually go and request to get a PSA blood test. Which will give you a little indication, it’s not a sure result.

"But if there’s a sign that the readings are elevated, and if it’s the case you can have further examinations rectally, which is an awkward thing for men to talk about.

"Men don’t get an offer to come in, you can request it. Really that should move."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Penny explained that Rod have a few symptoms and moved quickly to go and see a specialist, who found a lump that could not be ignored.

She said: "It was [quite aggressive]. It came on really quickly. With Rod it was an aggressive one. It left the gland and travelled to the outside tissues.

"So that was another scary moment where we had to have more invasive tests and scans to see if it was anywhere else secondary in his body, which was the most frightening test of all. But it hadn’t gone."

(Image: ITV)

Emotional Penny then broke down in tears, admitting it was obvious she was going to get upset discussing her husband's cancer struggle.

She tearfully continued: "It’s emotional. We kept it quiet for two and a half years now. The positive news is we caught it early enough."

On telling their children, she said: "We told the older ones… It would be too much for them [the younger ones] to understand.

"When daddy finally told everybody the good news, and to get the message out there for guys out there over 50 go and get the test, then we told the little ones."

*Loose Women airs weekdays on ITV at 12.30pm
description: Emotional Penny had some positive news about Rod, who sent an inspiring video message in calling for men to get tested for prostate cancer
